title: Buying a House üè†
description: Buying a house is a major financial and emotional milestone. It requires careful planning, research, and understanding of the legal and financial processes involved.
sentences: Determine your budget and get a home loan pre-approved.
Location is a critical factor; consider commute, amenities, and future development.
Differentiate between under-construction and ready-to-move-in properties.
Always perform due diligence on the property's legal documents.
Factor in additional costs like registration, stamp duty, and maintenance.
dos: Engage a reputable lawyer to verify property documents.
Visit the property at different times of the day.
Get a home inspection done for resale properties.
Negotiate the price with the seller or builder.
donts: Don't stretch your budget beyond your means.
Don't skip the fine print in the sale agreement.
Avoid making cash payments without proper documentation.
Don't rely solely on the builder's promises; get everything in writing.
